name: Orion
desc: The Hunter — a prominent constellation located on the celestial equator and visible throughout the world. It is one of the most conspicuous and recognizable constellations in the night sky.

name: Cassiopeia
desc: The Queen — a W-shaped or M-shaped constellation, depending on the season. It is easy to spot in the northern sky and is named after the boastful queen Cassiopeia in Greek mythology.

name: Lyra
desc: The Lyre — a small constellation noted for its primary star, Vega, which is one of the brightest stars in the night sky. It contains the Ring Nebula, a well-known planetary nebula.

name: Ursa Major
desc: The Great Bear — a large constellation in the northern sky. Its most famous part is the Big Dipper, an asterism of seven bright stars that form a dipper or ladle shape.

name: Andromeda
desc: The Chained Maiden — a constellation in the northern celestial hemisphere. Its most notable feature is the Andromeda Galaxy (M31), the nearest major galaxy to the Milky Way.
